P03.Name: Ripple effect, 2022
P03.Tagline: Discover Ripple effect, a public artwork in Parramatta celebrating connection to Country, water, shared histories and community stories
P03.Description: Water is essential to life, and human history tells us that thriving civilisations are born around the riverbanks. The artist Syed’s affinity for water resonates with the history of the first known residents along the Indus River in Sindh, Pakistan, specifically the Mohenjo-Daro (part of a larger culture known as the Harappans), as well as with the Parramatta River and its waterways, its Indigenous people, and the evolving culture.

P04.Name: Bare Skills
P04.Location: PAS Granville, 4 Bridge St, Granville NSW 2142
P04.Tagline: Bare Skills is a new series of art and survival workshops for young people aged 14 to 25, developed by Parramatta Artists Studios and hosted every second month at PAS Granville.
P04.Description: Bringing together experts and knowledge holders in climate resilience, land-based traditions and apocalyptic aesthetics, Bare Skills participants learn how they can use their creativity to survive in the face of existential crisis. Inspired by consultation with Parramatta youth, this new program aims to redefine learning and creative experiences for young people led by young people. Bare Skills is a safe and supportive space that encourages skill-sharing, truth-telling, intergenerational solidarity, and expansive definitions of creativity – or what it means to be an artist at the end of the world.
